document.ModsDocTitle: First record of Eubroncus (Hymenoptera, Mymaridae) from China, with description of three new species
document.docTitle: Eubroncus hani Jin & Li, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: First record of Eubroncus (Hymenoptera, Mymaridae) from China, with description of three new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: First record of Eubroncus (Hymenoptera, Mymaridae) from China, with description of three new species

subSubSection.paragraph: Eubroncus hani Jin & Li sp. n. Figs 1-9
♀ China, Yunnan Province, Lijiang City, Mt. Yulongxueshan, 3000m, 8-9. VII. 2012, Xiang-Xiang Jin, Hui-Lin Han, Hui Geng, Chao Zhang (NEFU), YPT.
With same data as holotype (3♀♀, NEFU).

Vertex with light reticulation; pronotum with a faint longitudinal carina medially; scutellum with short transverse row of fovea medially; hind wing with a group of notably long setae on disc behind the distal part of marginal vein; petiole with relatively long spine-like projections anterolaterally.

Description. Female. Body length 1.08-1.15 mm. Head black with ocelli and mandibles brown and eyes pinkish. Antenna dark brown with apical part of radicle brown and scape yellowish-brown. Mesosoma blackish with pronotum dark brown. Wings infuscate with base of forewing dark brown, largely less infuscate behind the marginal vein and apical part of submarginal vein. Legs brown except protibial spur, trochanters, basal three tarsal segments light brown. Metasoma brown with ovipositor light brown.

Head (Fig. 1) 1.11 -1.15x as long as wide. Eye subtriangular, with relatively long setae, each seta longer than the diameter of a facet. Vertex 1.1 -1.3x as long as wide, with light reticulate sculpture. Ocelli in an obtuse triangle; mid ocellus oval, MOL 1.2 -1.8x as long as OD; post ocellus oval, OCL approximately as long as POD; POL about 4.7 -5.1x as long as OOL. Mandibles (Fig. 2) 0.68 -0.78x as long as head and 1.0 -1.1x as long as vertex in dorsal view. Antenna (Fig. 3) with radicle 0.2 -0.4x as long as scape; scape with light reticulate sculpture, 4.0 -5.4x as long as wide; pedicel 1.6 -2.0x as long as wide, 2.5 -2.8x as long as fl1; fl2-fl6 each with 2 mps; clava a little shorter than scape, 2.2 -2.5x as long as wide, with 6-8 mps.

Mesosoma (Fig. 4) 1.80 -2.07x as long as wide. Pronotum 0.61 -0.76x as long as wide, with a faint longitudinal carina medially, each lobe with about 24-33 setae dorsally. Mesoscutum 0.41 -0.47x as long as wide, and 0.72 -0.83x as long as pronotum. Scutellum 0.83 -0.96x as long as mesoscutum, with short transverse row of fovea medially; distance between placoid sensilla 1.4 -1.6x as long as their own diameter. Propodeum 0.85 -1.00x as long as mesoscutum, 1.0 -1.1x as long as scutellum, with light reticulate sculpture, with one pair of tooth-like projections posterolaterally and 2-3 fine setae.

Forewing (Fig. 5) 3.86 -4.10x as long as wide, longest marginal setae about 0.25 -0.34x as long as greatest wing width. Beneath or on the submarginal vein with 9-12 setae. Marginal vein with 8-11 setae along anterior margin. Hind wing (Fig. 6) 7.6 -8.0x as long as wide, longest marginal setae about 0.86 -0.93x as long as greatest wing width, with 1 long seta and 1 short seta on marginal vein, and a group of notably long setae on disc behind the distal part of marginal vein.

Petiole (Fig. 8) 1.22 -1.45x as long as wide, with relatively long spine-like projections anteriolaterally. Gaster oblong, 0.90 -1.05x as long as mesosoma; Gt1 and Gs1 with numerous prominent and sclerotized carinae; ovipositor (Fig. 9) not or only slightly exserted; about 0.66 x as long as mesotibia (Fig. 7).
Relative measurements. OD 16-18, OCL 16-18, OOL 16-18, POL 82-84, LOL 36, POD 14-16.
The species is named for Dr. Hui-Lin Han, Northeast Forestry University, China.
